author: BVM Sportsdesk
title: Long Beach State Falls to UC Irvine 80-75 in Overtime Thriller
text:
Long Beach State Falls to UC Irvine 80-75 in Overtime Thriller
In a highly competitive matchup, Long Beach State fell short in overtime against UC Irvine, losing 80-75 in the 119th rivalry game. The Beach, supported by an enthusiastic crowd, led for over 20 minutes but couldn't secure the win despite strong performances from their starters. Devin Askew topped the team with 18 points, while Derrick Michael Xzavierro recorded a double-double with 12 points and 14 rebounds. An intense second half saw both teams exchanging momentum until UCI capitalized in overtime to seal the victory.
- Long Beach State led for over 20 minutes in the game.
- Derrick Michael Xzavierro had a double-double with 12 points and 14 rebounds.
- Long Beach State now holds a record of 7-15 and 3-7 in Big West conference play.
- UC Irvine improves to 19-3, maintaining a strong position with a 9-1 record in the conference.
Long Beach State is set to face UC Santa Barbara on Saturday, which will be another critical conference matchup for the Beach as they strive to improve their standings.
Bottom LineThe game highlighted Long Beach State's resilience but also underscored the need for improved shooting, as their 35% from three-point range contrasted sharply with UC Irvine's 55%, proving costly in the tight contest.
